===Noun===
{{zh-noun}}

# {{lb|zh|Mainland China}} [[spouse]], [[husband]] or [[wife]]
# [[sweetheart]]; [[lover]]

====Usage notes====
In [[mainland China]], {{zh-l|情人|lover}} usually refers to a partner in an extramarital relationship except in {{zh-l|情人節|Valentine's Day}}. For a person who loves, {{zh-l|愛人|lover}} is popular among elder people, while {{zh-l|戀人|lover}} is popular among young people.

==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|あい|じん|yomi=on}}

===Etymology===
Borrowed from {{etyl|zh|ja|sort=あいしん}} in the late 1800s as a translation of English terms {{m|en|sweetheart}} or {{m|en|lover}}. Compare modern {{cog|cmn|愛人|tr=àiren}}.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|あいじん|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|あいじん}}

# a [[lover]], a [[mistress]]
#: Implies an [[extramarital]] relationship. Most often used by a man in reference to a woman.
# {{lb|ja|archaic|sort=あいしん}} a [[sweetheart]], a [[loved one]]

====Related terms====
* {{ja-r|恋人|こいびと}}: a [[boyfriend]], a [[girlfriend]]
